text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make a rustic mushroom

addictive I have to tell you if your

to do so let's get started by showing
you exactly what you're going to need
you're going to need a mixture of
mushrooms and I've got some white button
mushrooms on baby portobello some large
portabellas some oyster mushrooms and
some shiitake mushrooms you're also
going to need some garlic a little bit
of butter some thyme some Marsala wine
some bread of course you need salt and
pepper and a little bit of olive oil now
you can use any kind of mushrooms you
have on hand or that you prefer if you
want to make this entirely with button
mushrooms please do if you want to make
this with just portobello mushrooms
please do it's completely up to you I
just happen to have found a pack in my

and if you don't want to use a more
salad wine just replace it with a little
bit of chicken stock so now the first
thing we're gonna do is get a nonstick
skillet with high sides with about a
tablespoon of olive oil in there and you
want that over medium-high heat
and now to that I'm going to add in my
mushrooms now the reason why I'm adding
mushrooms first instead of the garlic is
because I really want to get the
mushrooms to a really just deep
golden-brown color and I think that it's
such a high heat the garlic would burn
before the mushrooms were achieved set
that color so that's why I'm adding the
mushrooms in first and all I'm going to
do is just give this a stir and I'm not
going to add any salt to this and that's
because salt draws out moisture and if
this all jaws on moisture to my
mushrooms are going to release their
liquid before they get that golden brown

go for a good 5 to 7 minutes until they
start to cook down my mushrooms are

beautifully deep golden-brown they've

going to add in my garlic
and then let it cook for about 30
seconds or so or until it starts to

now turning me down to medium now they
don't need him high the whole time
some now let this cook for literally a

add in a little teeny tiny bit of butter
and my fresh thyme and the butter really
isn't that much is about a teaspoon but
this is really it's gonna make it so
delicious when rich and it just goes
